title: Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site: Education
body: Knife River Indian Villages In Your Classroom Â  Knife River Indian Villages NHS is working to provide quality curriculum-based resources and activities for teachers. There is no fee to visit the park. If you would like to bring a school group to the park, you need to make a reservation by calling 701-745-3300 or you can contact the education specialist.   Distance Learning Opportunities If you have videoconferencing capabilities Knife River Indian Villages NHS offers distance learning programs via the internet.                        ArcheoBlitz This unique three-day event investigates Hidatsa cultural resources with student-focused archeology. Read More        Nature and Science Knife River Indian Villages NHS is home to many types of different plants and animals. Read More        Teachers Curriculum Guide Explore the different curriculum guides for your classroom. Read More        Teaching with Historic Places Knife River: Early Village Life on the Plains Read More        Kid's Camp Come to Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site this July for some summer fun.
